name: LCDPossible Core Panels
author: LCDPossible Team
description: Core system information panels including CPU, GPU, RAM, and basic system info.

panelTypes.description: Detailed CPU information including model, usage, temperature, frequency, and power
panelTypes.helpText:
Displays comprehensive CPU information in a formatted layout:
- CPU model name and architecture
- Current usage percentage
- Temperature (if sensors available)
- Clock frequency
- Power consumption (if available)

Requires LibreHardwareMonitor for Windows sensor data.

panelTypes.description: CPU usage displayed as large text percentage
panelTypes.helpText:
Shows CPU usage as a large, easy-to-read percentage number.
Ideal for at-a-glance monitoring when detailed info isn't needed.

The text scales to fill the display for maximum visibility.

examples.description: Display CPU usage as large text

panelTypes.description: CPU usage with graphical bars including per-core breakdown
panelTypes.helpText:
Displays CPU usage with visual progress bars:
- Overall CPU usage bar at the top
- Individual bars for each CPU core
- Percentage labels for each core
- Color-coded bars (green/yellow/red based on load)

Great for monitoring multi-core workloads.

examples.description: Display CPU usage with graphical bars

panelTypes.description: Memory information including total, used, and available
panelTypes.helpText:
Shows detailed memory information:
- Total physical RAM
- Used memory
- Available memory
- Usage percentage
- Memory type/speed (if available)

panelTypes.description: RAM usage displayed as large text
panelTypes.helpText:
Shows memory usage as a large, easy-to-read percentage.
Ideal for quick visibility of memory pressure.

examples.description: Display RAM usage as large text

panelTypes.helpText:
Displays memory usage with a visual progress bar:
- Large progress bar showing used vs total
- Percentage label
- Used/Total values in GB
- Color changes based on usage level

examples.description: Display RAM usage with graphical bar

panelTypes.description: GPU information including model, usage, temperature, and VRAM
panelTypes.helpText:
Displays comprehensive GPU information:
- GPU model name
- GPU core usage percentage
- GPU temperature
- VRAM usage (used/total)
- GPU clock speed
- Power consumption (if available)

Supports NVIDIA, AMD, and Intel GPUs via LibreHardwareMonitor.

panelTypes.description: GPU usage displayed as large text
panelTypes.helpText:
Shows GPU usage as a large, easy-to-read percentage.
Ideal for monitoring GPU load during gaming or rendering.

examples.description: Display GPU usage as large text

panelTypes.helpText:
Displays GPU usage with visual progress bars:
- GPU core usage bar
- VRAM usage bar
- Temperature indicator
- Percentage labels

Color-coded bars indicate load level.

examples.description: Display GPU usage with graphical bars

panelTypes.description: Basic system information including hostname, OS, and uptime
panelTypes.helpText:
Displays basic system identification:
- Computer hostname
- Operating system name and version
- System uptime
- Current date and time

No special dependencies required - works on all platforms.

examples.description: Combine basic info with CPU usage in a slideshow

panelTypes.helpText:
Shows a compact summary of system resource usage:
- CPU usage percentage
- RAM usage percentage
- GPU usage percentage

All values displayed on a single panel for quick overview.

panelTypes.description: CPU temperature with graphical gauge display
panelTypes.helpText:
Displays CPU temperature as a visual gauge:
- Thermometer-style visualization
- Current temperature value
- Color-coded (green/yellow/red) based on temperature
- Min/Max indicators if available

panelTypes.description: GPU temperature with graphical gauge display
panelTypes.helpText:
Displays GPU temperature as a visual gauge:
- Thermometer-style visualization
- Current temperature value
- Color-coded based on temperature
- Useful for monitoring during gaming/rendering

panelTypes.description: Combined CPU and GPU temperature display with vertical thermometers
panelTypes.helpText:
Shows both CPU and GPU temperatures side-by-side:
- Two vertical thermometer displays
- CPU temperature on left
- GPU temperature on right
- Color-coded based on temperature levels

Ideal for monitoring thermal performance during intensive tasks.

examples.description: Display CPU and GPU temperatures together

panelTypes.description: Network configuration including hostname, IP addresses, gateway, and DNS
panelTypes.helpText:
Displays network configuration details:
- Hostname
- Primary IP address(es)
- Default gateway
- DNS servers
- Active network adapter name

Works on all platforms without additional dependencies.
